description: From Middle English writer, writere, from Old English wrītere (“draughtsman; painter; writer; scribe; copyist”) and ġewritere (“writer; composer”), equivalent to write +‎ -er and writ +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: A person who writes, or produces literary work; an author can refer to themself as "the writer".
examples: Has your girlfriend written you another letter already? She’s quite a writer!
I met some of my favourite authors at the writers' convention.

entries.meaning: Anything that writes or produces output.
examples: If the writer is set to autoflush mode, then all characters in the buffer are sent to their destination whenever println is called.

entries.meaning: (historical) A clerk of a certain rank in the service of the East India Company, who, after serving a certain number of years, became a factor.
(Scotland) An ordinary legal practitioner in Scottish country towns.
(US) A petty officer in the United States navy who keeps the watch-muster and other books of the ship.
